page.title: 08Housing -Basegreen/Hemsworth
page.content: In the Frechville area there are two main areas of housing seperated by Fox Lane. The Frecheville houses were built in 1936 by H.Boot and Sons. The houses were administered by the First National Housing Trust. Most of the houses have been sold and are now owner-occupied. The Basegreen houses were built by Sheffield City Council in the 1950's.This is an attractive quiet estate with some owner-occupied houses.Basegreen estate was built to house families from many parts of Sheffield. In the Hemsworth area there are mostly council houses,with a growing number of private dwellings.There are a number of blocks of flats for old age pensioners
